suspicious_process.title: Suspicious Program Detected
suspicious_process.description: A potentially harmful program was found running on your system.
advice: Immediately close the suspicious program
Run a full system antivirus scan
Check if this program was intentionally installed
If unsure, disconnect from the network and seek IT support
suspicious_process.remediation: Terminate the process and remove the executable file from the system.

brute_force.title: Multiple Failed Login Attempts
brute_force.description: Someone or something is trying to guess your password repeatedly.
advice: Check if YOU are the one trying to log in (maybe wrong password?)
If not you, this could be an attack
Change your password immediately to a strong, unique one
Enable two-factor authentication if available
Review recent login history
brute_force.remediation: Lock the account temporarily and enable account lockout policies.

suspicious_port.title: Connection to Unusual Network Port
suspicious_port.description: A program is communicating through a port commonly used by hackers.
advice: Identify which program is using this port
Check if this is a legitimate business application
Consider blocking the port in your firewall
Monitor for continued suspicious activity
suspicious_port.remediation: Block the port in firewall rules and investigate the source application.

high_resource_usage.title: Program Using Too Much Computer Resources
high_resource_usage.description: A program is consuming excessive CPU or memory, which might slow your system.
advice: Check Task Manager to see which program is responsible
Determine if this is expected (e.g., video rendering, game)
If unexpected, it could be malware or cryptocurrency miner
Consider closing or investigating the program
high_resource_usage.remediation: Terminate high-resource processes if not legitimate.

file_tampering.title: Critical System File Was Modified
file_tampering.description: Important system files have been changed, which could compromise security.
advice: This is VERY SERIOUS - system files should not change unexpectedly
Run System File Checker (sfc /scannow)
Perform a full malware scan immediately
Consider restoring from a known good backup
Contact IT support urgently
file_tampering.remediation: Run system integrity checks and restore modified files from backup.

network_scan.title: Excessive Network Activity Detected
network_scan.description: A program is making many network connections, possibly scanning for vulnerabilities.
advice: Identify the program making these connections
Check if it's legitimate (antivirus, system update, etc.)
If unknown, this could be malware or a network scanner
Disconnect from network if needed
Run security scans
network_scan.remediation: Block the offending process and investigate its purpose.

privilege_escalation.title: Unauthorized Privilege Increase Attempt
privilege_escalation.description: A program tried to gain administrator/higher-level access without authorization.
advice: This is a CRITICAL security event
Check if YOU requested admin access (UAC prompt)
If not, malware may be trying to take control
Deny the privilege request
Run full security scan immediately
privilege_escalation.remediation: Block privilege escalation and investigate the source process.

suspicious_script.title: Potentially Malicious Script Execution
suspicious_script.description: A script file (PowerShell, batch file, etc.) is running that might be harmful.
advice: Check what script is running and why
Scripts can be used by attackers to automate attacks
If you didn't run it intentionally, stop it
Review the script content if possible
Consider disabling script execution if not needed
suspicious_script.remediation: Terminate script execution and analyze script content.

data_exfiltration.title: Large Data Transfer Detected
data_exfiltration.description: A significant amount of data is being sent out of your system to the internet.
advice: Identify which program is sending data
Check if this is expected (cloud backup, file upload, etc.)
If suspicious, this could be data theft in progress
Immediately disconnect from network if confirmed malicious
Contact IT security team
data_exfiltration.remediation: Block outbound connection and investigate data destination.

code_injection.title: Code Injection Detected
code_injection.description: A program is trying to inject code into another program's memory space.
advice: This is EXTREMELY SERIOUS - hallmark of advanced malware
Disconnect from network immediately
Do NOT continue using the system
Run offline security scan if possible
Contact cybersecurity expert or IT support urgently
code_injection.remediation: Isolate system, terminate all suspicious processes, perform deep malware scan.
